page.title: 17Farming
page.content: The photographs show that this area is one of well managed farmland,most of it being used for crops although some is pasture.Farmers have ,in most cases, practiced conservation well,leaving hedgerows and woodland. There is an abundance of wildlife, including pheasants, rabbits, hares and many species of birds. There was no evidence of leaking of dangerous chemicals into the river Witham .Aerial spraying was not in evidence during our visits.The tractor marks in the fields were noticeable from the spraying of a fungicide this year because of the wet spring.Local residence agree that the situation has improved since the new straw burning laws have been introduced. The Witham valley is picturesque and the landscape is only marred by a series of pylons along the valley.
